intro: Hieracium comosum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with erect, hairy stems and basal leaves that are usually heart-shaped. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium comosum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes and seeds.
